intro: Didonica panamensis, commonly known as the Panamanian didonica, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its palm-like appearance with smooth, waxy leaves. The plant produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
